scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment (O.B.O.C.W.W.B). It is also known as AFPSEBOCWWB. The “Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment” scheme by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board. Under this scheme, the Board shall make one time reimbursement to each beneficiary who is registered with the Board for purchasing Safety Equipment like Helmet, Safety shoes and Hand-gloves on production of original bill/ voucher.
<br> The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Odisha. Additionally, the nodal department is Labour and Employees State Insurance Department.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Quantum of Assistance: ₹1,000/.

Eligibility criteria include: > For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:


  The applicant should be a resident of Odisha.
  The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker.
  The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years.
  The applicant should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year.
  The applicant should not be a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law.

> For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:


  The applicant should be a registered member of the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
  The applicant should have deposited uptodate annual contributions for one year to the Board. The application process is as follows: > Registration Process as a Building/ Construction Worker:

Step 1: Visit the official website of the Odisha BOCWW Board.
Step 2: Click on “One Time Registration” on the top right side of the page.
Step 3: Click on the Declaration box and then on the “Proceed” button.
Step 4: In the next window fill in all the required details carefully and click on “Proceed”.
Step 5: Enter the received OTP and click on “Submit”.
Step 6: Your account will be successfully created and a Username will be displayed (Keep the Username for future references).
> Application Process of the Welfare Scheme:

Step 1: Visit the Applicant Login page of the Odisha BOCWW Board.
Step 2: Enter your Username, OTP and fill in the captcha then click on “Sign In”.
Step 3: In the next window, fill in your General Details, Address Details, Family &amp; Nominee Details, Details of the establishment(s) where the applicant worked during the last one year, Bank Details etc. and then click on “Submit”.
Step 4: Now in the Menu bar section, click on “Benefit”. From the list select the concerned benefit you want to apply.
Step 5: Fill in all the mandatory details carefully and click on “Submit” to complete the application process.
> Check Your Application Status: Registered workers can check their application status through visiting this link upon entering their Application Tracking Number.

> Pay Annual Contribution: Registered workers can pay the Annual Contribution through visiting this link upon entering their Registration Number. > Registration Process as a Building/ Construction Worker:

Step 1: To register as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board, an applicant worker should download FormXXVII and attach all the mandatory documents (selfattested, if required).
Step 2: Application shall be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area.
> Application Process of the Welfare Scheme:

Step 1: A registered worker should download FormXLIV and attach all the mandatory documents (selfattested, if required).
Step 2: Application shall be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://labdirodisha.gov.in/?q=node/15%27%3B Guidelines: https://bocboard.labdirodisha.gov.in/Building/homecontent/standard_procedure/Ltr%20No.%201596%20dtd.%2023.10.2013.pdf Tags associated with the scheme include: Building Worker, Construction Worker, Hand Gloves, Helmet, Labour, Safety Equipment, Safety Shoes.

"}, {"question": "Is there a minimum service requirement to register as a beneficiary?", "answer": "Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months. "}, {"question": "Who can apply for the welfare scheme?", "answer": "Any registered worker of the Board can apply for the welfare scheme. "}, {"question": "Who is responsible for registering a worker as a beneficiary?", "answer": "The District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. "}, {"question": "Who is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board?", "answer": "Every building worker who is between the age of 18-60 years and who has been engaged in any building or other construction work for not less than 90 days during the preceding one year is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board of Odisha. "}, {"question": "What is the procedure for applying for the registration?", "answer": "To register as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board, an applicant worker should download Form-XXVII and attach all the mandatory documents (self attested, if required) and a fee of ₹20/- to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. You can obtain this form from the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors in your area."}, {"question": "How much is the fee associated with the registration process?", "answer": "The registration fee is ₹20/- which is payable during the registration. "}, {"question": "What happens after I pay the application fee?", "answer": "After you pay the application fee of ₹20/-, your application will be reviewed by the registering officer. The decision to approve or reject your application will be based on the merits of your application. "}, {"question": "Who decides whether my application will be approved or rejected?", "answer": "The registering officer is responsible for deciding whether your application will be approved or rejected based on its merits. "}, {"question": "Can my application be rejected even if I have paid the application fee?", "answer": "Yes, your application can be rejected even if you have paid the application fee. The final decision is made by the registering officer based on the merits of your application. "}, {"question": "How much is the fee associated with the renewal of the registration?", "answer": "The renewal fee is ₹50/- which is payable during the renewal process of the registration. "}, {"question": "What criteria must an applicant meet to be considered for this benefit?", "answer": "A registered member under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Odisha, who has deposited up-to-date annual contributions for one year, shall be considered for this benefit. "}, {"question": "How much reimbursement can a beneficiary receive for the purchase of Safety Equipments?", "answer": "A beneficiary can receive reimbursement of up to ₹1,000/- for the purchase of Safety Equipments. "}, {"question": "Where can the beneficiary purchase safety equipments?", "answer": "The beneficiary must purchase safety equipments from any registered shop with a TIN/ SRIN number. "}, {"question": "Is physical verification of the purchased items necessary?", "answer": "Yes, the beneficiary is required to present the purchased bicycle and safety equipment to the Registering Officer-cum-District Labour Officer for verification. "}, {"question": "How will the reimbursement amount be disbursed to the beneficiary?", "answer": "The benefit amount will be released through an A/C Payee Cheque or bank transfer only. "}, {"question": "Will the reimbursement be recorded anywhere?", "answer": "Yes, the benefit given will be reflected in the beneficiary's Pass Book as well as in the office copy of the Pass Book. scheme_data.combined_text:
The name of this welfare scheme is Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment (O.B.O.C.W.W.B). It is also known as AFPSEBOCWWB. The “Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment” scheme by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board. Under this scheme, the Board shall make one time reimbursement to each beneficiary who is registered with the Board for purchasing Safety Equipment like Helmet, Safety shoes and Hand-gloves on production of original bill/ voucher. <br> The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Odisha. Additionally, the nodal department is Labour and Employees State Insurance Department. The scheme provides the following benefits: Quantum of Assistance: ₹1,000/. Eligibility criteria include: > For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker: The applicant should be a resident of Odisha. The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker. The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years. The applicant should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year. The applicant should not be a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law. > For the Application of the Welfare Scheme: The applicant should be a registered member of the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. The applicant should have deposited uptodate annual contributions for one year to the Board. The application process is as follows: > Registration Process as a Building/ Construction Worker: Step 1: Visit the official website of the Odisha BOCWW Board. Step 2: Click on “One Time Registration” on the top right side of the page. Step 3: Click on the Declaration box and then on the “Proceed” button. Step 4: In the next window fill in all the required details carefully and click on “Proceed”. Step 5: Enter the received OTP and click on “Submit”. Step 6: Your account will be successfully created and a Username will be displayed (Keep the Username for future references). > Application Process of the Welfare Scheme: Step 1: Visit the Applicant Login page of the Odisha BOCWW Board. Step 2: Enter your Username, OTP and fill in the captcha then click on “Sign In”. Step 3: In the next window, fill in your General Details, Address Details, Family & Nominee Details, Details of the establishment(s) where the applicant worked during the last one year, Bank Details etc. and then click on “Submit”. Step 4: Now in the Menu bar section, click on “Benefit”. From the list select the concerned benefit you want to apply. Step 5: Fill in all the mandatory details carefully and click on “Submit” to complete the application process. > Check Your Application Status: Registered workers can check their application status through visiting this link upon entering their Application Tracking Number. > Pay Annual Contribution: Registered workers can pay the Annual Contribution through visiting this link upon entering their Registration Number. > Registration Process as a Building/ Construction Worker: Step 1: To register as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board, an applicant worker should download FormXXVII and attach all the mandatory documents (selfattested, if required). Step 2: Application shall be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area. > Application Process of the Welfare Scheme: Step 1: A registered worker should download FormXLIV and attach all the mandatory documents (selfattested, if required). Step 2: Application shall be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://labdirodisha.gov.in/?q=node/15%27%3B Guidelines: https://bocboard.labdirodisha.gov.in/Building/homecontent/standard_procedure/Ltr%20No.%201596%20dtd.%2023.10.2013.pdf Tags associated with the scheme include: Building Worker, Construction Worker, sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment (O.
B.
O.
C.
W.
W.
It is also known as AFPSEBOCWWB.

The “Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment” scheme by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board.

Under this scheme, the Board shall make one time reimbursement to each beneficiary who is registered with the Board for purchasing Safety Equipment like Helmet, Safety shoes and Hand-gloves on production of original bill/ voucher.
<br> The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.
It is specifically implemented in Odisha.
Additionally, the nodal department is Labour and Employees State Insurance Department.
The scheme provides the following benefits: Quantum of Assistance: ₹1,000/.
Eligibility criteria include: > For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker: The applicant should be a resident of Odisha.
The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker.
The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years.
The applicant should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year.
The applicant should not be a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law.
> For the Application of the Welfare Scheme: The applicant should be a registered member of the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The applicant should have deposited uptodate annual contributions for one year to the Board.
The application process is as follows: > Registration Process as a Building/ Construction Worker: Step 1: Visit the official website of the Odisha BOCWW Board.
Step 2: Click on “One Time Registration” on the top right side of the page.
Step 3: Click on the Declaration box and then on the “Proceed” button.
Step 4: In the next window fill in all the required details carefully and click on “Proceed”.
Step 5: Enter the received OTP and click on “Submit”.
Step 6: Your account will be successfully created and a Username will be displayed (Keep the Username for future references).
> Application Process of the Welfare Scheme: Step 1: Visit the Applicant Login page of the Odisha BOCWW Board.
Step 2: Enter your Username, OTP and fill in the captcha then click on “Sign In”.

Step 3: In the next window, fill in your General Details, Address Details, Family &amp; Nominee Details, Details of the establishment(s) where the applicant worked during the last one year, Bank Details etc.
and then click on “Submit”.
Step 4: Now in the Menu bar section, click on “Benefit”.
From the list select the concerned benefit you want to apply.
Step 5: Fill in all the mandatory details carefully and click on “Submit” to complete the application process.
> Check Your Application Status: Registered workers can check their application status through visiting this link upon entering their Application Tracking Number.
> Pay Annual Contribution: Registered workers can pay the Annual Contribution through visiting this link upon entering their Registration Number.

> Registration Process as a Building/ Construction Worker: Step 1: To register as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board, an applicant worker should download FormXXVII and attach all the mandatory documents (selfattested, if required).
Step 2: Application shall be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D.
L.
O)/ Asst.
Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area.
> Application Process of the Welfare Scheme: Step 1: A registered worker should download FormXLIV and attach all the mandatory documents (selfattested, if required).
Step 2: Application shall be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D.
L.
O)/ Asst.
Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area.
For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://labdirodisha.

ctus.text: The name of this welfare scheme is Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment (O. B. O. C.
W. W. B). It is also known as AFPSEBOCWWB.

The “Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment” scheme by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board. Under this scheme, the Board shall make one time reimbursement to each beneficiary who is registered with the Board for purchasing Safety Equipment like Helmet, Safety shoes and Hand-gloves on production of original bill/ voucher. <br> The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Odisha.

Additionally, the nodal department is Labour and Employees State Insurance Department. The scheme provides the following benefits: Quantum of Assistance: ₹1,000/. Eligibility criteria include: > For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker: The applicant should be a resident of Odisha. The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker.

The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years. The applicant should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year. The applicant should not be a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law. > For the Application of the Welfare Scheme: The applicant should be a registered member of the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.

The applicant should have deposited uptodate annual contributions for one year to the Board. The application process is as follows: > Registration Process as a Building/ Construction Worker: Step 1: Visit the official website of the Odisha BOCWW Board. Step 2: Click on “One Time Registration” on the top right side of the page. Step 3: Click on the Declaration box and then on the “Proceed” button.

Step 4: In the next window fill in all the required details carefully and click on “Proceed”. Step 5: Enter the received OTP and click on “Submit”. Step 6: Your account will be successfully created and a Username will be displayed (Keep the Username for future references). > Application Process of the Welfare Scheme: Step 1: Visit the Applicant Login page of the Odisha BOCWW Board.

Step 2: Enter your Username, OTP and fill in the captcha then click on “Sign In”. Step 3: In the next window, fill in your General Details, Address Details, Family &amp; Nominee Details, Details of the establishment(s) where the applicant worked during the last one year, Bank Details etc. and then click on “Submit”. Step 4: Now in the Menu bar section, click on “Benefit”.

From the list select the concerned benefit you want to apply. Step 5: Fill in all the mandatory details carefully and click on “Submit” to complete the application process. > Check Your Application Status: Registered workers can check their application status through visiting this link upon entering their Application Tracking Number. > Pay Annual Contribution: Registered workers can pay the Annual Contribution through visiting this link upon entering their Registration Number.

> Registration Process as a Building/ Construction Worker: Step 1: To register as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board, an applicant worker should download FormXXVII and attach all the mandatory documents (selfattested, if required). Step 2: Application shall be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D. L. O)/ Asst.

Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area. > Application Process of the Welfare Scheme: Step 1: A registered worker should download FormXLIV and attach all the mandatory documents (selfattested, if required). Step 2: Application shall be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D. L.
O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://labdirodisha. gov.

tagged_ctus.text: The name of this welfare scheme is Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment (O. B. O. C.
W. W. B). It is also known as AFPSEBOCWWB.

The “Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment” scheme by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board. Under this scheme, the Board shall make one time reimbursement to each beneficiary who is registered with the Board for purchasing Safety Equipment like Helmet, Safety shoes and Hand-gloves on production of original bill/ voucher. <br> The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Odisha.

Additionally, the nodal department is Labour and Employees State Insurance Department. The scheme provides the following benefits: Quantum of Assistance: ₹1,000/. Eligibility criteria include: > For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker: The applicant should be a resident of Odisha. The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker.

The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years. The applicant should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year. The applicant should not be a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law. > For the Application of the Welfare Scheme: The applicant should be a registered member of the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.

The applicant should have deposited uptodate annual contributions for one year to the Board. The application process is as follows: > Registration Process as a Building/ Construction Worker: Step 1: Visit the official website of the Odisha BOCWW Board. Step 2: Click on “One Time Registration” on the top right side of the page. Step 3: Click on the Declaration box and then on the “Proceed” button.

Step 4: In the next window fill in all the required details carefully and click on “Proceed”. Step 5: Enter the received OTP and click on “Submit”. Step 6: Your account will be successfully created and a Username will be displayed (Keep the Username for future references). > Application Process of the Welfare Scheme: Step 1: Visit the Applicant Login page of the Odisha BOCWW Board.

Step 2: Enter your Username, OTP and fill in the captcha then click on “Sign In”. Step 3: In the next window, fill in your General Details, Address Details, Family &amp; Nominee Details, Details of the establishment(s) where the applicant worked during the last one year, Bank Details etc. and then click on “Submit”. Step 4: Now in the Menu bar section, click on “Benefit”.

From the list select the concerned benefit you want to apply. Step 5: Fill in all the mandatory details carefully and click on “Submit” to complete the application process. > Check Your Application Status: Registered workers can check their application status through visiting this link upon entering their Application Tracking Number. > Pay Annual Contribution: Registered workers can pay the Annual Contribution through visiting this link upon entering their Registration Number.

> Registration Process as a Building/ Construction Worker: Step 1: To register as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board, an applicant worker should download FormXXVII and attach all the mandatory documents (selfattested, if required). Step 2: Application shall be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D. L. O)/ Asst.

Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area. > Application Process of the Welfare Scheme: Step 1: A registered worker should download FormXLIV and attach all the mandatory documents (selfattested, if required). Step 2: Application shall be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D. L.

of Odisha vide Notification dated. 28. 07. 2014 also specified the following categories of works as building and other construction works.

• Minor Port. 
• Cutting, breaking and crushing of stone. 
• Cutting and polishing of slabs or tiles. 
• Woodwork including painting and varnishing.

• Sewerage and plumbing work. 
• Electrical works including wiring, distribution and panel fixing. 
• Installation and repair of fire fighting systems. 
• Installation and repair of cooling and heating system.

• Installation of lifts and escalators. 
• Installation of security gates. 
• Fabrication and installation of iron or metal grills, windows and doors. 
• Construction of water harvesting structures.

• Interior work including carpeting, false ceiling, lighting and plaster of paris. 
• Cutting, glazing and installation of glass panels. 
• Making of Bricks and roofing tiles not covered under the Factories Act, 1948. 
• Installation of energy efficient equipment like solar panels.

• Installation of modular units for use in places such as kitchens. 
• Making and installation of pre-fabricated concrete modules. 
• Construction of sports or recreation facilities including swimming pools and golf courses. 
• Construction or erection of signage, road furniture, bus shelters or depots or stands and signalling systems.

 - The applicant should be a resident of Odisha. 
 - The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker. 
 - The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years. 
 - The applicant should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year.

- The applicant should not be a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law. 

> **For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:**


 - The applicant should be a registered member of the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. 
 - The applicant should have deposited up-to-date annual contributions for one year to the Board.

prompts.ctu_text: The “Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment” scheme by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board. Under this scheme, the Board shall make one time reimbursement to each beneficiary who is registered with the Board for purchasing Safety Equipment like Helmet, Safety shoes and Hand-gloves on production of original bill/ voucher. <br> The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Odisha.
